channel.title: Basics 📚 on Analyst
channel.description: Recent content in Basics 📚 on Analyst

item.title: Data Types
item.description: VarInt Is used to safe memory. For example, number 5 only occupies 1 byte, but 1032 will need two bytes to live.

item.title: Memory Addressing
item.description: I’ve had a lot of time to dive into certain pecularities of how programs are outlined both in RAM and on disk when working as a malware analyst.

item.title: Compilation and Linking 🔗
item.description: In this article I am trying to reasearch compilation and linking process. Terms .cpp - is a human-readable file written in any programming language.

item.title: Interrupts
item.description: This is an article about hardware interrupts, how they are designed and what for are used.

item.title: Packers and Unpacking
item.description: References [1] Manual unpacking (rus 🇷🇺) [2] Unpacking FSG 2.0 (rus 🇷🇺) [3] Introduction to unpacking (rus 🇷🇺)

item.title: Processes, threads and mutants zombie 🧟‍♂️
item.description: In this article I am describing the difference between a process, thread and mutex. Process When and exe file or other executable file is run, some memory in RAM is allocated and the program’s code and data is read from the hard drive and written into RAM.

item.title: iOS Reverse Engineering
item.description: During forensic analysis it’s not too rare to run into some suspicious application. In this article I’m going to learn to reverse engineer iOS applications.

item.title: Cracking 🔨
item.description: Any cracking career is supposed to start with solving simple crackme’s. I’ve not been doing it all the time, but I’ve solved several of them from the simplest to a very hard one which required some math knowledge 😬. This allowed me to craft some sort of algorithm I would like to share."
